text: "Fresh Eyes" is a song from American musician Andy Grammer, serving as a single from his third studio album. It was made available for digital download on July 29, 2016 through S-Curve Records. Grammer co-wrote the song with Ross Golan and Ian Kirkpatrick. The song is a charity single with all proceeds going to the Union Rescue Mission in Los Angeles, a private Christian homeless shelter in downtown Los Angeles's Skid Row. ==Composition== "Fresh Eyes" is written in the key of G major with a tempo of 126 beats per minute. The song follows a chord progression of Em-D-G-C, and Grammer's vocals span from D4 to G5. ==Music video== A music video was filmed in Los Angeles in September 2016 and launched on October 19, 2016. It documents Grammer's visit to Union Rescue Mission where residents were given makeovers. ==Live performances== Grammer performed "Fresh Eyes" on The Today Show on August 1, 2016. Grammer also performed “Fresh Eyes” on NBC's New Year's Eve on December 31, 2018. ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {|class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- !
